sentence.text: Drug Label for drug brand ALTACE, containing ramipril.

mmtx.phraseText: Drug Label for drug brand ALTACE,
Drug Label for drug brand ALTACE,

sentence.text: ALTACE is contraindicated in patients who are hypersensitive to this product or any other ACE inhibitor (e.g., a patient who has experienced angioedema during therapy with any other ACE inhibitor).
<item>Increased risk of renal impairment when combined with another blocker of the rein-angiotensin-aldosterone system (5.7)

mmtx.phraseText: combined with another blocker of the rein-angiotensin-aldosterone system
combined with another blocker of the rein-angiotensin-aldosterone system

sentence.text: Presumably because drugs that act directly on the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (e.g., ACE inhibitors) affect the metabolism of eicosanoids and polypeptides, including endogenous bradykinin, patients receiving these drugs (including ALTACE) may be subject to a variety of adverse reactions, some of them serious.
In considering the use of ALTACE, note that in controlled clinical trials ACE inhibitors cause a higher rate of angioedema in Black patients than in non-Black patients.

mmtx.phraseText: that in controlled clinical trials ACE inhibitors

sentence.text: The angioedema was diagnosed by procedures including abdominal CT scan or ultrasound, or at surgery, and symptoms resolved after stopping the ACE inhibitor.
Two patients undergoing desensitizing treatment with hymenoptera venom while receiving ACE inhibitors sustained life-threatening anaphylactoid reactions.
Rarely, ACE inhibitors, including ALTACE, have been associated with a syndrome that starts with cholestatic jaundice and progresses to fulminant hepatic necrosis and sometimes death.
As ramipril is primarily metabolized by hepatic esterases to its active moiety, ramiprilat, patients with impaired liver function could develop markedly elevated plasma levels of ramipril.

mmtx.phraseText: markedly elevated plasma levels of ramipril.

sentence.text: As a consequence of inhibiting the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system, changes in renal function may be anticipated in susceptible individuals.

In patients with severe congestive heart failure whose renal function may depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system, treatment with ACE inhibitors, including ALTACE, may be associated with oliguria or progressive azotemia and rarely with acute renal failure or death.

mmtx.phraseText: depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system,
depend on the activity of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system,

sentence.text: Experience with another ACE inhibitor suggests that these increases would be reversible upon discontinuation of ALTACE and/or diuretic therapy.

Some hypertensive patients with no apparent pre-existing renal vascular disease have developed increases in blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine, usually minor and transient, especially when ALTACE has been given concomitantly with a diuretic.

entity.text: hypertensive patients with no apparent pre-existing renal vascular disease

mmtx.phraseText: Some hypertensive patients with no apparent pre-existing renal vascular disease

sentence.text: Dosage reduction of ALTACE and/or discontinuation of the diuretic may be required.
Like other ACE inhibitors, ALTACE, has been only rarely associated with hypotension in uncomplicated hypertensive patients.
In patients with heart failure post-myocardial infarction who are currently being treated with a diuretic, symptomatic hypotension occasionally can occur following the initial dose of ALTACE.

mmtx.phraseText: treated with a diuretic, symptomatic hypotension occasionally

sentence.text: If the initial dose of 2.5 mg ALTACE cannot be tolerated, use an initial dose of 1.25 mg ALTACE to avoid excessive hypotension.

mmtx.phraseText: an initial dose of 1.25 mg ALTACE to

ellipsisSentence.text: In patients with heart failure post-myocardial infarction who are currently being treated with a diuretic, symptomatic hypotension occasionally can occur following the initial dose of ALTACE.

sentence.text: Consider reducing the dose of concomitant diuretic to decrease the incidence of hypotension.

mmtx.phraseText: the dose of concomitant diuretic to

ellipsisSentence.text: If the initial dose of 2.5 mg ALTACE cannot be tolerated, use an initial dose of 1.25 mg ALTACE to avoid excessive hypotension.

sentence.text: In such patients, initiate ALTACE therapy under close medical supervision and follow patients closely for the first 2 weeks of treatment and whenever the dose of ALTACE or diuretic is increased.

mmtx.phraseText: ALTACE therapy under close medical supervision

sentence.text: In patients undergoing surgery or during anesthesia with agents that produce hypotension, ramipril may block angiotensin II formation that would otherwise occur secondary to compensatory renin release.
5.7 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System

mmtx.phraseText: 5.7 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System
5.7 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System
5.7 Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System

sentence.text: The ONTARGET trial enrolled 25,620 patients 55 years old with atherosclerotic disease or diabetes with end-organ damage, randomized them to telmisartan only, ramipril only, or the combination, and followed them for a median of 56 months.

Patients receiving the combination of telmisartan and ramipril did not obtain any benefit in the composite endpoint of cardiovascular death, MI, stroke and heart failure hospitalization compared to monotherapy, but experienced an increased incidence of clinically important renal dysfunction (death, doubling of serum creatinine, or dialysis) compared with groups receiving telmisartan alone or ramipril alone.
Concomitant use of telmisartan and ramipril is not recommended.
In clinical trials with ALTACE, hyperkalemia (serum potassium 5.7 mEq/L) occurred in approximately 1% of hypertensive patients receiving ALTACE.

Risk factors for the development of hyperkalemia include renal insufficiency, diabetes mellitus, and the concomitant use of potassium-sparing diuretics, potassium supplements, and/or potassium-containing salt substitutes, which should be used cautiously, if at all, with ALTACE see Drug Interactions (7.1).

mmtx.phraseText: the concomitant use of potassium-sparing diuretics,

sentence.text: Diuretics: Possibility of excessive hypotension (7.1).
Lithium: Use with caution (7.3).
Gold: Nitritoid reactions have been reported (7.4).
NSAIDS use may lead to increased risk of renal impairment and loss of antihypertensive effect (7.5).

mmtx.phraseText: lead to increased risk of renal impairment
lead to increased risk of renal impairment

sentence.text: Patients on diuretics, especially those in whom diuretic therapy was recently instituted, may occasionally experience an excessive reduction of blood pressure after initiation of therapy with ALTACE.
The possibility of hypotensive effects with ALTACE can be minimized by either decreasing or discontinuing the diuretic or increasing the salt intake prior to initiation of treatment with ALTACE.
If this is not possible, reduce the starting dose see Dosage and Administration (2).

ellipsisSentence.text: The possibility of hypotensive effects with ALTACE can be minimized by either decreasing or discontinuing the diuretic or increasing the salt intake prior to initiation of treatment with ALTACE.
The possibility of hypotensive effects with ALTACE can be minimized by either decreasing or discontinuing the diuretic or increasing the salt intake prior to initiation of treatment with ALTACE.

sentence.text: ALTACE can attenuate potassium loss caused by thiazide diuretics.
Potassium-sparing diuretics (spironolactone, amiloride, triamterene, and others) or potassium supplements can increase the risk of hyperkalemia.
Therefore, if concomitant use of such agents is indicated, monitor the patient's serum potassium frequently.

antecedentSentence.Text: ALTACE can attenuate potassium loss caused by thiazide diuretics.
Potassium-sparing diuretics (spironolactone, amiloride, triamterene, and others) or potassium supplements can increase the risk of hyperkalemia.
Potassium-sparing diuretics (spironolactone, amiloride, triamterene, and others) or potassium supplements can increase the risk of hyperkalemia.

ellipsisSentence.text: ALTACE can attenuate potassium loss caused by thiazide diuretics.

middleSentence.text: Potassium-sparing diuretics (spironolactone, amiloride, triamterene, and others) or potassium supplements can increase the risk of hyperkalemia.

sentence.text: Limited experience in controlled and uncontrolled trials combining ALTACE with a calcium channel blocker, a loop diuretic, or triple therapy (beta-blocker, vasodilator, and a diuretic) indicate no unusual drug-drug interactions.

mmtx.phraseText: ALTACE with a calcium channel blocker,
ALTACE with a calcium channel blocker,

sentence.text: Other ACE inhibitors have had less than additive effects with beta adrenergic blockers, presumably because both drug classes lower blood pressure by inhibiting parts of the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system.
The combination of ramipril and propranolol showed no adverse effects on dynamic parameters (blood pressure and heart rate).

In a large-scale, long-term clinical efficacy study, the combination of telmisartan and ramipril resulted in an increased incidence of clinically important renal dysfunction (death, doubling of serum creatinine, dialysis) compared with groups receiving either drug alone.
Therefore, concomitant use of telmisartan and ramipril is not recommended see Dual Blockade of the Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System (5.7).

Increased serum lithium levels and symptoms of lithium toxicity have been reported in patients receiving ACE inhibitors during therapy with lithium, therefore, frequent monitoring of serum lithium levels is recommended.

mmtx.phraseText: frequent monitoring of serum lithium levels

sentence.text: If a diuretic is also used, the risk of lithium toxicity may be increased.

Nitritoid reactions (symptoms include facial flushing, nausea, vomiting and hypotension) have been reported rarely in patients on therapy with injectable gold (sodium aurothiomalate) and concomitant ACE inhibitor therapy including ALTACE.
7.5 Non-Steroidal Anti-Inflammatory Agents including Selective Cyclooxygenase-2 Inhibitors (COX-2 Inhibitors)

In patients who are elderly, volume-depleted (including those on diuretic therapy), or with compromised renal function, co-administration of NSAIDs, including selective COX-2 inhibitors, with ACE inhibitors, including ramipril, may result in deterioration of renal function, including possible acute renal failure.
Monitor renal function periodically in patients receiving ramipril and NSAID therapy.
The antihypertensive effect of ACE inhibitors, including ramipril, may be attenuated by NSAIDs.

mmtx.phraseText: The antihypertensive effect of ACE inhibitors,

sentence.text: Neither ramipril nor its metabolites have been found to interact with food, digoxin, antacid, furosemide, cimetidine, indomethacin, and simvastatin.
The co-administration of ramipril and warfarin did not adversely affect the anticoagulation effects of the latter drug.
Additionally, co-administration of ramipril with phenprocoumon did not affect minimum phenprocoumon levels or interfere with the patients' state of anticoagulation.
